column4: does anyone know what causes this error: ssh: connect to host xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx port xx: connection timed out
you aren't logging in/authenticating to it.
it doesn't give me the chance, it used to prompt for a password, now it sits there until i get the time out message
and you're using the same procedure now has you did in the past? Maybe it has been locked down?
i've been trying to setup vnc over ssh but i don't think i've changed anything in the ssh settings
do you currently have physical access to the server?
yes
can you ping the server, and vice versus?
yes, successful ping in both directions
hmmm, weird, no other error messages?
not that i can tell, both pc's are right in front of me, on the client i enter ssh -X user@host and the cursor moves down 1 line and blinks until the time out error is shown
and i've shut down and restarted the sshd several times but that didn't help
I thought the command was ssh -l usernam blah blah blah?
i don't think you need the -l if you use username@host, -l is for ssh username "space" host
Could be? How about machine name. -l username. Maybe the DNS has changed?
didn't help
thanks for your help, i'll try a full reboot tomorrow and see if it fixes it
ok, good luck, 73
google 73 and ham radio. :)
ahh, anyway, thanks again
